antispoofing.mcnns.measure package¶

Submodules¶

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure module¶

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.acc_threshold(ground_truth, scores, threshold, label_neg, label_pos)[source]¶

Compute the Accuracy upon a given threshold.

Parameters:
  • ground_truth (numpy.ndarray) – The ground-truth.
  • scores (numpy.ndarray) – The predicted scores.
  • threshold (float) – Threshold value.
  • label_neg (int) – Label for the negative class.
  • label_pos (int) – Label for the positive class.
Returns:

Return the balanced accuracy, whose value can varies between 0.0 and 1.0, which means the worst and the perfect classification results, respectively.
Return type:

float
antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.bacc_threshold(ground_truth, predicted_scores, threshold, label_neg, label_pos)[source]¶

Compute the Balanced accuracy upon a given threshold.

Parameters:
  • ground_truth (numpy.ndarray) – The ground-truth.
  • predicted_scores (numpy.ndarray) – The predicted scores.
  • threshold (float) – Threshold value.
  • label_neg (int) – Label for the negative class.
  • label_pos (int) – Label for the positive class.
Returns:

Return the balanced accuracy considering a given threshold. The balanced accuracy can varies between 0.0 and 1.0, which means the worst and the perfect classification results, respectively.
Return type:

float
antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.balanced_accuracy(ground_truth, predicted_labels)[source]¶

Compute the Balanced accuracy

Parameters:
  • ground_truth (numpy.ndarray) – The ground-truth.
  • predicted_labels (numpy.ndarray) – The predicted labels.
Returns:

Return the balanced accuracy, whose value can varies between 0.0 and 1.0, which means the worst and the perfect classification results, respectively.
Return type:

float

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.compute_det(negatives, positives, n_points)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • negatives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the negative class.
  • positives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the positive class.
  • n_points (int) – Number of points considered to build the curve.

Returns:

Note

We suppose that negative scores is on the left side of the positive scores Deprecated condition: We suppose that negative scores is lower than 0 and positive scores os upper than 0

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.eer_threshold(neg_scores, pos_scores, n_points=1000)[source]¶

Compute the EER threshold, that is, the threshold in that the FAR = FRR

Parameters:
  • neg_scores (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the negative class.
  • pos_scores (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the positive class.
  • n_points (int) – Number of points considered to build the curve. Default is 1000.

Returns:

Note

We suppose that negative scores is on the left side of the positive scores Deprecated condition: We suppose that negative scores is lower than 0 and positive scores os upper than 0

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.far_threshold(negatives, positives, far_at)[source]¶

Compute the threshold in that FAR=far_value

Parameters:
  • negatives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the negative class.
  • positives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the positive class.
  • far_at (float) – A value for the false acceptance rate.

Returns:

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.farfrr(negatives, positives, threshold)[source]¶

Compute the False Acceptance and the False Rejection Rates considering a given threshold value.

Parameters:
  • negatives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the negative class.
  • positives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the positive class.
  • threshold (float) – A threshold value.

Returns:

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.farfrr_curve(negatives, positives, n_points=1000)[source]¶

Compute the far and frr curve

Parameters:
  • negatives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the negative class.
  • positives (numpy.ndarray) – The scores for the positive class.
  • n_points (int) – Number of points considered to build the curve. Default is 1000.

Returns:

Note

We suppose that negative scores is on the left side of the positive scores Deprecated condition: We suppose that negative scores is lower than 0 and positive scores os upper than 0

antispoofing.mcnns.measure.measure.predicted_labels_threshold(scores, threshold, label_neg, label_pos)[source]¶

This function compute the predicted labels for the testing set based on the their scores.

Parameters:
  • scores (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array containing the predicted scores.
  • threshold (float) – Threshold value.
  • label_neg (int) – Label for the negative class.
  • label_pos (int) – Label for the positive class.
Returns:

Return the predicted labels.
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
